text:
Hmm . . . this sounds familiar . . . 
0:56

'Cuz I wonder where you are,
And I wonder what you do,
Are you somewhere feelin' lonely?
Or is someone lovin' you?
1:17
Tell me how to win your heart,
'Cuz I haven't got a clue,
But I want to tell you so much-
I love you.

text:
Silvagunner #1 for soundtracks.
However even the best soundtracks have a number of flaws among them, just those few tracks that you can't stand.
Supradarky provides merely the best so that you don't have to go digging through to find the goodies, they're all right here! The only exceptions are the games he doesn't have up yet. But hey, uploading an entire soundtrack you just set it to upload, this IS harder since you have to get personally involved with the work, so kudos to you Supra.

text: congrats..! besides silvagunner you are source no.1 for the best VGM! Keep up the great work!! By the way, do you already reserve a track for the 1000 or will it be more or less a spontanious choice?

author: Snow Eskimo Jo

text:
Ah, one of those good old Anime-based games that were common on the SNES.

A few of them were of surprisingly good quality (Such as the Slayers RPG, which had a startlingly good plot for being a completely original sidestory merging the novels, anime, and OVAs all at once), and this one apparently had some damn fine music.

author: Renphalos

text:
@VGKing at 0:41 the tunes infront of the Eerie feels like some sort of beautiful dance, but the background hints of something very sinister plotting your demise.
And later at 1:06 the darkness comes forth with the light tunes, dancing together intil 1:41, where they seperate and splitting apart more and more, until 1:56 where the Darkness whims swoons, trying to get the Lightheartness back. 
An eternal seductional piece...

Did you get any of that? XD I don't know why I wrote this.

text: Nice theme, fits an eerie castle well, although I've never played the game. Makes me want to play the game though :D
author: bobofabyss

text:
A very enjoyable SNES platformer from Enix, unfortunately only released in Japan. This is the final castle.

I just saw a couple minutes ago that the channel reached 10,000 subscribers which is unbelievable! Thanks to all of you. I'll make a small video tomorrow so I can show you guys (if you're curious) some of the numbers this channel is currently generating, with the Insight feature I have access to. It's definitely come a long way!
author: SupraDarky
